title: Emergency Evacuation Procedures
introduction: This guide covers evacuation protocols for different types of emergencies, ensuring your safety and the safety of others.

preparations.title: Create a Family Plan:
preparations.info: Develop a plan that includes designated meeting points, alternate evacuation routes, and how to reconnect if separated.

preparations.title: Identify Safe Locations:
preparations.info: Determine where you would go in the event of an evacuation, such as a hotel, friend's house, or a designated shelter.

preparations.title: Have a Disaster Kit:
preparations.info: Assemble a kit with essential supplies like water, non-perishable food, first-aid supplies, and medication.

preparations.title: Practice:
preparations.info: Rehearse your evacuation plan, including how to access your emergency kit and how to reach your designated meeting place.

preparations.title: Sign Up for Notifications:
preparations.info: Subscribe to our webApp to receive timely warnings about potential disasters/war.

todo.title: Leave Early
todo.info: Evacuate as soon as directed by authorities, avoiding congestion and potential delays.

todo.title: Follow Recommended Routes:
todo.info: Adhere to official evacuation routes and avoid shortcuts, as they may be blocked.

todo.title: Stay Informed :
todo.info: Listen to radio, watch TV, or use your phone to stay updated on the latest information and weather conditions.

todo.title: Take Your Kit:
todo.info: Bring your disaster supply kit with you when evacuating.

todo.title: Secure Your Home:
todo.info: Lock doors and windows, secure pets, and unplug appliances if possible.

todo.title: Inform Others:
todo.info: Call or email an out-of-state contact to let them know where you are going and how to reach you

followthese.title: Assess for Damage:
followthese.info: Check your home for damage and report any problems to authorities.

followthese.title: Check for Injuries:
followthese.info: Assess for any injuries to yourself or others.

followthese.title: Follow Instructions:
followthese.info: Listen to instructions from local authorities and follow their guidance on returning home.

calamity_types.name: Floods
calamity_types.procedure: Move to higher ground immediately. Turn off all utilities (electricity, gas, water). Do not walk or drive through floodwaters. Follow official evacuation routes.

calamity_types.name: Earthquakes
calamity_types.procedure: During shaking, Drop, Cover, and Hold On. After shaking stops, evacuate to an open area away from buildings and power lines. Be prepared for aftershocks.

calamity_types.name: Cyclones/Storms
calamity_types.procedure: Secure loose outdoor items. Stay indoors in a safe room. If instructed to evacuate, do so immediately to designated shelters. Listen to official weather alerts.

calamity_types.name: Hurricanes
calamity_types.procedure: Seek shelter indoors and away from windows.

calamity_types.name: Wildfires
calamity_types.procedure: Evacuate immediately and follow evacuation routes.

sections.heading: Evacuation during War/Conflict

war_scenarios.name: Artillery/Missile Attack
war_scenarios.procedure: Seek immediate cover in a sturdy building, basement, or designated shelter. Stay away from windows. If caught outdoors, lie flat on the ground. Once safe, move to a designated assembly point.

war_scenarios.name: Ground Invasion/Frontline Proximity
war_scenarios.procedure: If safe to do so, move away from conflict zones towards humanitarian corridors or designated safe areas. Travel in groups if possible. Avoid main roads if they are conflict areas.

Tips for your safety and self defense: keep a knife with you or in your kit

sections.heading: General Evacuation Guidelines
sections.content: Always have an emergency bag ready. Know your community's evacuation plan. Inform family members of your whereabouts. Do not return to an evacuated area until authorities declare it safe.
